newsitem.title: CHINA: China Legend sales seen up 60 pct in '96.
newsitem.headline: China Legend sales seen up 60 pct in '96.

text.p: Chinese computer firm Legend Holding's sales are expected to jump 60 percent to $80 million in 1996 from 1995, a company official said on Monday.

The state-owned computer maker forecast that sales of integrated systems would reach 600 million yuan ($72.3 million) in 1996 and 2.0 billion yuan by the year 2000, the official said but gave no further details.
Legend sold more than 80,000 personal computers in the first half of 1996, up by 126 percent from the year-ago period, according to the latest available data.
Legend slashed prices of its personal computers by 10 percent earlier this month, saying that good sales and profits in the first half justified the cuts.
